author: Special Correspondent
text:
A youth from Bihar, B. Thallu Kumar Besar (20), died of asphyxiation when he got into a bleaching tank in a paper manufacturing unit at Nallichathiram near here on Tuesday afternoon.

Two other youths, K. Santhosh (36) and S. Bharat Kumar Pandey (39), both from Uttar Pradesh, who attempted to get Besar out of the tank, fainted.

They have been admitted to Tirunelveli Medical College Hospital after being given first aid at Kovilpatti.

Police said that the deceased had joined the paper unit very recently.

“Besar got into the overhead tank used for bleaching the paper to clean it. He suffered asphyxiation due to leakage of poisonous gas and died on the spot. The other two had attempted to pull him out,” Sattur Tahsildar R.K. Pushparajan said.

Officials of Tamil Nadu Pollution Control Board were inspecting the unit, he added.

Sattur (Taluk) Inspector of Police Subakumar inspected the unit, owned by S. Varatharaju of Kovilpatti.
title: Bihar youth dies of asphyxiation; two hospitalised
